info.p: OWL (Web Ontology Language) is a knowledge representation language designed for publishing and sharing ontologies on the World Wide Web.By providing a richer vocabulary and formal semantics compared to XML, RDF, and RDF Schema (RDF-S), OWL allows for more complex descriptions of concepts, relationships, and constraints within a domain.
See the : W3C OWL Web Ontology Language definition for an introduction and also OWL features for a detailed overview.
